body_html: It is not beginner friendly, the best way is to find a commit that added fp16 support and use that as a template. Here's a mega-commit that added fp16 to a bunch of ops, although there are probably smaller examples -- 9bedadc
body_text: It is not beginner friendly, the best way is to find a commit that added fp16 support and use that as a template. Here's a mega-commit that added fp16 to a bunch of ops, although there are probably smaller examples -- 9bedadc
body: It is not beginner friendly, the best way is to find a commit that added fp16 support and use that as a template. Here's a mega-commit that added fp16 to a bunch of ops, although there are probably smaller examples -- https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/9bedadce
